nyc-landmarks.description: Only intact known property directly associated with Admiral David Farragut

nyc-landmarks.name: Ambrose (lightship)
nyc-landmarks.description: Lightship, several miles offshore, that marked Ambrose Channel into New York Harbor, now at South Street Seaport Museum.

nyc-landmarks.name: American Stock Exchange Building
nyc-landmarks.description: World-class stock exchanges dating back to colonial times. Building area 181,725sq.ft.<ref>{{cite web|title=New York Curb Exchange|

nyc-landmarks.description: Home of jazz legend Louis Armstrong for 28 years

nyc-landmarks.description: Home of photographer Alice Austen, now a museum

nyc-landmarks.description: 19th-century mansion in largest New York City park

nyc-landmarks.name: Brooklyn Bridge
nyc-landmarks.description: The Brooklyn Bridge is a hybrid cable-stayed/suspension bridge in New York City, spanning the East River between the boroughs of Manhattan and Brooklyn.

nyc-landmarks.name: Brooklyn Heights Historic District
nyc-landmarks.description: Exemplary collection of 19th-century architectural styles; first historic district in New York City

nyc-landmarks.description: One of the few remaining buildings by George B. Post; innovative structural system

nyc-landmarks.description: Home of Ralph Johnson Bunche, eminent African-American diplomat and Undersecretary General of United Nations

nyc-landmarks.description: One of the most famous music venues in the world

nyc-landmarks.description: Home of Andrew Carnegie, now the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum

nyc-landmarks.name: Central Park
nyc-landmarks.description: The Green Lung of the city; one of the most visited city parks in the world; designed by Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert

nyc-landmarks.description: Oldest synagogue continuously in use by a New York City Jewish congregation; built in a Moorish Revival style to recognize

nyc-landmarks.name: Chamber of Commerce Building
nyc-landmarks.description: New York City's Chamber of Commerce; established in 1768; prototype for the organization

nyc-landmarks.name: Chrysler Building
nyc-landmarks.description: Art Deco skyscraper; distinctive feature of Manhattan skyline; at one point world's tallest building

nyc-landmarks.name: Church of the Ascension
nyc-landmarks.description: Early church design by Richard Upjohn; valuable interior artwork

nyc-landmarks.name: City Hall
nyc-landmarks.description: Oldest city hall in U.S. still in use as main municipal government building

nyc-landmarks.description: Pioneering adult education center; site of famous anti-slavery speech by Abraham Lincoln

nyc-landmarks.name: Eldridge Street Synagogue
nyc-landmarks.description: One of the oldest synagogues in the U.S.; first built by Jews from Eastern Europe

nyc-landmarks.description: Tunnel underneath the Hudson River, connecting Manhattan and New Jersey; civil engineering landmark; one of the

nyc-landmarks.description: One of the most active U.S. ships during World War II; today a museum moored along the West Side

nyc-landmarks.description: Harlem home of African-American artist-activist James Weldon Johnson

nyc-landmarks.description: One of the largest and most important libraries in the U.S.; listing is for main branch building.

nyc-landmarks.name: Margaret Sanger Clinic
nyc-landmarks.description: Clinic where Margaret Sanger dispensed birth control

nyc-landmarks.description: America's Town Meetings of the Air radio programs from here in the 1930s created public-affairs media.
